list.name: Changes
list.comment: - Added getter method to BattlePanel.java to access the monster image label - MainFrame.java uses that new getter method to disable the visibility of the old monster to allow new ones to spawn in without showing previous monsters.

task.summary: Default task
Commit skeleton for DungeonCharacter.java + Room.java. Also, src folder created and rooted as source
updated the .gitignore file
updated the .gitignore file

Third Commit: - Fixed the toString() method in DungeonCharacter class to reflect the changes made for extended children classes. - Finished the getters/setters for the data fields of DungeonCharacter.java - Added NEW_LINE constant field in DungeonCharacter.java
Completed Monster.java Class
added "drafted" attack() method in DungeonCharacter.java
added 2 enum classes for our Potential Room items and to clean up the Room class, the use of enum Direction class
Main.java, MainFrame.java, StartingScreenPanel.java added to the project
Created the GUI MainMenu for the game, with buttons in place and BG image

Created CharacterSelectionPanel.java, which is the menu when a player starts a new game. updated DungeonCharacter.java to be an abstract class. Updated the MainMenuPanel.java to Center Title and buttons on the screen
When "New Game" Btn is pressed, CardLayout Manager updates to CharacterSelectionPanel.java and when "Back" Btn is pressed on that panel, it takes us back to MainMenuPanel.java.

Finished the CharacterSelectionPanel.java (other than changing the fonts + setting up action for begin adventure button) Created an OptionsPanel.java to house some game options for the user. (only have data fields in place.
Finished OptionsPanel.java, GameInformationPanel.java, and GameHelpPanel.java Updated MainFrame.java cardLayout to hold the new panels.
MainFrame.java in views package refactored to follow Checkstyle + update readability
MainMenuPanel.java in views package refactored to follow Checkstyle + update readability. Also, MainFrame.java updated to reflect changes.
CharacterSelectionPanel.java in views package refactored to follow Checkstyle + update readability. Also, MainFrame.java updated to reflect changes.
OptionsPanel.java in views package refactored to follow Checkstyle + update readability. Also, MainFrame.java updated to reflect changes.
GameInformationPanel.java in views package refactored to follow Checkstyle + update readability. Also, MainFrame.java updated to reflect changes.
GameHelpPanel.java in views package refactored to follow Checkstyle + update readability. Also, MainFrame.java updated to reflect changes.
Added BattlePanel.java and GamePlayPanel.java to views package
Added instance fields and instantiations for those fields in GamePlayPanel.java class.

- Added constraint if no name entered for Hero, user is prompt the game cannot start without a name. - Added the BG image for the main gameplay in the dungeon. - Added the character, "test" sprite and the movement buttons, panel to the GamePlayPanel.java. - Added health bar to the bottom of the main game panel - Added the "save game" and "inventory" Buttons to the game panel - Made miscellaneous changes to reflect the addition of the GamePlayPanel.java in the various other view class models - Added more images to the imgs package
- Added the BattlePanel.java to display the battle panel when the user enters a room with a monster - Added battle bg img and monster sprite img. - updated appropriate classes to reflect changes.

- Added a controller and models package to follow MVC standards - Moved appropriate packages to their designated package. - Refactored GamePlayPanel to follow Checkstyle guidelines. - Refactoreed BattlePanel to follow Checkstyle guidelines.
- Added SQLite DB table with monster information to the project.
- Added SQLiteDemo.java back into the project
- Updated Enum's to follow naming guidelines.
- Added the enums to the models package. - Added MonsterFactory.java file.

- Added default constructor to the Room.java class so each item can be set randomly within the Dungeon.java classes generateRandomRoom() method. - Completed majority of room randomization/generation. In order for it to be fully complete, MonsterFactory will have to be implemented + Room.java will need to add an instance field to hold the monster.

- Debugged randomlyGenerateRooms() method in Dungeon.java to generate playable maze. - added a checkIfMazeIsValid() method to check if our 2D maze is valid with all appropriate OO Pillar keys and entrance and exit for player. - Within the Room.java class, I added hasEntrance(), hasExit(), hasPillar() methods to return a boolean if the room contains one of those items.
- NOTE: Main.java used to test random room generation within the console.

- Changed the visibility of Ogre.java, Skeleton.java, and Gremlin.java to have public visibility to create the monster objects for the factory. - Completed the MonsterFactory.java class (needs refactoring to clean up code, but it works) - Added myRoomMonster instance field and getters and setters for it in the Room.java class - Implemented randomly picking and placing a monster within a room of the 2D-Matrix. - All still needs to be refactored to clean up

- Added @overriden toString() method for Ogre, Gremlin, Skeleton - Fixed Hero constructor to utilize set methods, and fixed it's toString() method to utilize the get methods - Fixed all the Hero's specialAttack() methods to specification guidelines.
- Reverted back to Original.
- Added character sprites to the imgs package for usage amoongst the project.
- Removed parameters from the contractors
- Updated visibility for the hero subclasses from default -> public
- Changed the family hierarchy of Hero's. DungeonCharacter -> Hero -> Adventurer -> Warrior, Thief, Priestess - Refactored Adventurer.java class

- Added direct image file path constants to the hero/adventurer subclasses and added @Overide getter method from Adventurer class to access them. - Whenever a user chooses their desired hero, the appropriate sprite shows up on the display for the user.
- Added resized Gremlin1.png sprite image

- Added hasRoomMonster() method to the Room.java class. - Added Img path instance fields for monster/hero and their appropriate getters/setters for those img paths in BattlePanel.java class. - Also added getter methods for Attack, SpecialAttack, and Heal Btns on the BattlePanel.java class. - Added getter methods for North, South, East, West Btns of the GamePlayPanel.java class. - Added appropriate action listeners to each of the btns on the panels in MainFrame.java class. (still designing their functionalities)
- Added getters/setters for each rooms row position and column position in Room.java. - Added a method to get the MAZE_SIZE in Dungeon.java.

- Within the MainFrame.java class, on the "Begin Your Adventure" game button, I added a for loop that checks for the entrance in the first row, once found the coordinates are stored and that room is stored in variable myCurrentRoom. - After, I have a helper method in MainFrame.java that will check all the room doors to see which ones are passable or not, the ones that are not will be greyed out and unusable, while the others will be usable. - I also set up a theoretical traversal of the maze by implementing the ActionListeners for the movement buttons, updating the rows and columns as necessary, re-checking passable doors. -

- Modified the myPillar instance field in Adventurer.java to be an ArrayList to hold our pillars. - Also added addPillarToPillarArray() method in Adventurer.java as well. - Added a getter method in all Monster subclasses to obtain their img sprites. - Added a method to the Monster.java class to be overriden by the subclasses to hold the file path for the sprite. - Added some has() boolean methods to a few fields in Room.java - In BattlePanel.java, I added current room monster and adventurer for the current game battle, added some methods to set the current room monster and the users adventurer. - Added to MainFrame.java methods for checking current room for ground loot and picking them up, checking room monster, then fighting them

- Added getter methods to the GamePlayPanel.java to access the save game and inventory button. - Updated the attack() method in the DungeonCharacter.java class - Added a Block Button to the BattlePanel - Refactored the heal() method in Monster.java - Refactored the specialAttack() methods for all subclasses - Added AttackBtn, SpecialAttackBtn, HealBtn, BlockBtn functionality in MainFrame.java class

- Added getter method to BattlePanel.java to access the monster image label - MainFrame.java uses that new getter method to disable the visibility of the old monster to allow new ones to spawn in without showing previous monsters.

MESSAGE.value: Added instance fields and instantiations for those fields in GamePlayPanel.java class.

option.name: LAST_COMMIT_MESSAGE
